intro: Alyxia ceylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon alyxia, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Alyxia ceylanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
